ActiveExperiment.description: The telemetry experiment active at the time of the crash, if any.
ActiveExperiment.name: ActiveExperiment

ActiveExperimentBranch.description: The experiment branch of the ActiveExperiment, if set.
ActiveExperimentBranch.name: ActiveExperimentBranch

accessibility.description: The presence of this field indicates that accessibility services were accessed.
accessibility.name: accessibility

accessibility_client.description: Out-of-process accessibility client program name and version information.
accessibility_client.name: accessibility_client

accessibility_in_proc_client.description: In-process accessibility client detection information. See Compatibility.h for more details.
accessibility_in_proc_client.name: accessibility_in_proc_client

adapter_vendor_id.description: The graphics adapter vendor. This value is sometimes a name, and sometimes a hexidecimal identifier. Common identifiers include: 0x8086 (Intel), 0x1002 (AMD), 0x10de (NVIDIA).
adapter_vendor_id.name: adapter_vendor_id

addons.description: A list of the addons currently enabled at the time of the crash. This takes the form of "addonid:version,[addonid:version...]". This value could be empty if the crash happens during startup before the addon manager is enabled, and on products/platforms which don't support addons.
addons.name: addons

address.description: The crashing address. This value is only meaningful for crashes involving bad memory accesses.
address.name: address

android_board.description: The board used by the Android device.
android_board.name: android_board

android_cpu_abi.description: The Android primary CPU ABI being used.
android_cpu_abi.name: android_cpu_abi

android_cpu_abi2.description: The Android secondary CPU ABI being used.
android_cpu_abi2.name: android_cpu_abi2

app_init_dlls.description: DLLs injected through the AppInit_DLLs registry key.
app_init_dlls.name: app_init_dlls

app_notes.description: Notes from the application that crashed. Mostly contains graphics-related annotations.
app_notes.name: app_notes

available_page_file.description: The maximum amount of memory the current process can commit. This value is equal to or smaller than the system-wide available commit value.
available_page_file.name: available_page_file

available_physical_memory.description: The amount of physical memory currently available. This is the amount of physical memory that can be immediately reused without having to write its contents to disk first.
available_physical_memory.name: available_physical_memory

available_virtual_memory.description: The amount of unreserved and uncommited (i.e. available) memory in the process's address space. Note that this memory may be fragmented into many separate segments, so an allocation attempt may fail even when this value is substantially greater than zero.
available_virtual_memory.name: available_virtual_memory

build_id.description: The unique build identifier of this version, which is a timestamp of the form YYYYMMDDHHMMSS.
build_id.name: build_id

co_get_interface_and_release_stream_fail.description: Contains the hexadecimal value of the return code from Windows CoGetInterfaceAndReleaseStream API when invoked by IPDL serialization and deserialization code.
co_get_interface_and_release_stream_fail.name: co_get_interface_and_release_stream_failure

co_marshal_interface_failure.description: Contains the hexadecimal value of the return code from Windows CoMarshalInterfaceFailure API when invoked by IPDL serialization and deserialization code.
co_marshal_interface_failure.name: co_marshal_interface_failure

contains_memory_report.description: Has content for processed_crash.memory_report or not.
contains_memory_report.name: contains_memory_report

cpu_arch.description:
The build architecture. Usually one of: 'x86', 'amd64' (a.k.a. x86-64), 'arm', 'arm64'.

Duplicate of cpu_name, with a better name.
cpu_arch.name: cpu_arch

cpu_count.description: Number of processor units in the CPU.
cpu_count.name: cpu_count

cpu_info.description: Detailed processor info. Usually contains information such as the family, model, and stepping number.
cpu_info.name: cpu_info

cpu_name.description: Architecture of the processor. Deprecated, use cpu_arch instead.
cpu_name.name: cpu_name

date.description: Date at which the crash report was received by Socorro.
date.name: date

dom_ipc_enabled.description: The value of the 'dom.ipc.enabled' preference (in other terms, whether e10s is enabled).
dom_ipc_enabled.name: dom_ipc_enabled

e10s_cohort.description: The e10s cohort. Values can be: "test", "control", "unsupportedChannel", "optedIn", "optedOut", "disqualified", "unsupportedChannel" or "unknown".
e10s_cohort.name: e10s_cohort

email.description: Users may opt in to providing their email address so that Mozilla may contact them about their crash report.
email.name: email

exploitability.description: An automated estimate of how exploitable this crash is.
exploitability.name: exploitability

flash_version.description: Version of the Flash Player plugin.
flash_version.name: flash_version

gmp_plugin.description: Whether it is a GMP plugin crash.
gmp_plugin.name: gmp_plugin

graphics_startup_test.description: Whether the crash occured in the DriverCrashGuard.
graphics_startup_test.name: graphics_startup_test

hang_type.description:
Tells if a report was caused by a crash or a hang. In the database, the value is `0` if the problem was a crash of the software, and `1` or `-1` if the problem was a hang of the software. 

Note: for querying, you should use `crash` or `hang`, since those are automatically transformed into the correct underlying values.
hang_type.name: hang_type

install_age.description: Length of time since this version was installed.
install_age.name: install_age

install_time.description: Epoch time of when this version was installed. Commonly used as a unique identifier for software installations (since it is unlikely that two instances are installed at the very same second).
install_time.name: install_time

ipc_fatal_error_msg.description: The message linked to an IPC fatal error.
ipc_fatal_error_msg.name: ipc_fatal_error_msg

ipc_fatal_error_protocol.description: The protocol linked to an IPC fatal error.
ipc_fatal_error_protocol.name: ipc_fatal_error_protocol

ipc_message_name.description: The name of the IPC message.
ipc_message_name.name: ipc_message_name

ipc_shutdown_state.description: Shows that a shutdown hang was after we have received RecvShutdown but never reach SendFinishShutdown or the hang happened before or after RecvShutdown. https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1301339
ipc_shutdown_state.name: ipc_shutdown_state

java_stack_trace.description: When Java code crashes due to an unhandled exception, this is the Java Stack Trace. It is usually more useful than the system stack trace given for the crashing thread.
java_stack_trace.name: java_stack_trace

json_dump.description: The dump as a JSON object.
json_dump.name: json_dump

last_crash.description: Length of time between the previous crash submission and this one. Low values indicate repeated crashes.
last_crash.name: last_crash

memory_explicit.description: The 'explicit' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_explicit.name: memory_explicit

memory_gfx_textures.description: The 'gfx-textures' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_gfx_textures.name: memory_gfx_textures

memory_ghost_windows.description: The 'ghost-windows' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_ghost_windows.name: memory_ghost_windows

memory_heap_allocated.description: The 'heap-allocated' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_heap_allocated.name: memory_heap_allocated

memory_heap_overhead.description: The 'heap-overhead' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_heap_overhead.name: memory_heap_overhead

memory_heap_unclassified.description: The 'heap-unclassified' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_heap_unclassified.name: memory_heap_unclassified

memory_host_object_urls.description: The 'host-object-urls' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_host_object_urls.name: memory_host_object_urls

memory_images.description: The 'images' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_images.name: memory_images

memory_js_main_runtime.description: The 'js-main-runtime' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_js_main_runtime.name: memory_js_main_runtime

memory_private.description: The 'private' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_private.name: memory_private

memory_resident.description: The 'resident' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_resident.name: memory_resident

memory_resident_unique.description: The 'resident-unique' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_resident_unique.name: memory_resident_unique

memory_system_heap_allocated.description: The 'system-heap-allocated' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_system_heap_allocated.name: memory_system_heap_allocated

memory_top_none_detached.description: The 'top(none)/detached' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_top_none_detached.name: memory_top_none_detached

memory_vsize.description: The 'vsize' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_vsize.name: memory_vsize

memory_vsize_max_contiguous.description: The 'vsize-max-contiguous' measurement from the memory report. See about:memory for a fuller description.
memory_vsize_max_contiguous.name: memory_vsize_max_contiguous

moz_crash_reason.description: For aborts caused by MOZ_CRASH, MOZ_RELEASE_ASSERT and related macros, this is the accompanying description.
moz_crash_reason.name: moz_crash_reason

oom_allocation_size.description: A measure or estimate of the allocation request size that triggered an OOM crash. Note that allocators usually work with large (e.g. 1 MiB) chunks of memory, and a small request may have triggered a large chunk request, in which case the latter actually caused the OOM crash.
oom_allocation_size.name: oom_allocation_size

platform.description: Basic name of the operating system. Can be "Windows NT", "Mac OS X" or "Linux". Use `platform_pretty_version` for a more precise OS name including version.
platform.name: platform

platform_pretty_version.description: A better platform name, including version for Windows and Mac OS X.
platform_pretty_version.name: platform_pretty_version

plugin_filename.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the name of the file of the plugin loaded into that process.
plugin_filename.name: plugin_filename

plugin_name.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the name of the plugin loaded into that process.
plugin_name.name: plugin_name

plugin_version.description: When a plugin process crashes, this is the version of the plugin loaded into that process.
plugin_version.name: plugin_version

process_type.description: What type of process the crash happened in. When the main process crashes, this will not be present. But when a plugin or content process crashes, this will be "plugin" or "content".
process_type.name: process_type

processor_notes.description: Notes of the Socorro processor, contains information about what changes were made to the report during processing.
processor_notes.name: processor_notes

proto_signature.description: A concatenation of the signatures of all the frames of the crashing thread.
proto_signature.name: proto_signature

reason.description: The crash's exception kind. Different OSes have different exception kinds. Example values: 'EXCEPTION_ACCESS_VIOLATION_READ', 'EXCEPTION_BREAKPOINT', 'SIGSEGV'.
reason.name: reason

release_channel.description: The update channel that the user is on. Typically "nightly", "aurora", "beta", or "release", but this may also be other values like "release-cck-partner".
release_channel.name: release_channel

remote_type.description: 'extension' if a WebExtension, 'web' or missing otherwise. This is only set for content crashes.
remote_type.name: remote_type

safe_mode.description: Was the browser running in Safe mode?
safe_mode.name: safe_mode

signature.description: This is the field most commonly used for aggregating individual crash reports into a group. It usually contains one or more stack frames from the crashing thread. The stack frames may also be augmented or replaced with other tokens such as 'OOM | small' or 'shutdownhang' that further identify the crash kind.
signature.name: signature

skunk_classification.description: The skunk classification of this crash report, assigned by the processors.
skunk_classification.name: skunk_classification

startup_crash.description: Annotation that tells whether the crash happened before the startup phase was finished or not.
startup_crash.name: startup_crash

status.description: Status of the output of the stackwalker. Can be "OK", "ERROR_*" or "SYMBOL_SUPPLIER_INTERRUPTED".
status.name: status

submitted_from_infobar.description: True if the crash report was submitted after the crash happened, from an infobar in the UI.
submitted_from_infobar.name: submitted_from_infobar

support_classification.description: The support classification of this crash report, assigned by the processors.
support_classification.name: support_classification

system_memory_use_percentage.description: The approximate percentage of physical memory that is in use.
system_memory_use_percentage.name: system_memory_use_percentage

telemetry_environment.description: A field containing the entire Telemetry Environment, as sent with crash pings to Telemetry.
telemetry_environment.name: telemetry_environment

threads_index.description: Index of this thread in the list of threads?
threads_index.name: threads_index

topmost_filenames.description: Paths of the files at the top of the stack.
topmost_filenames.name: topmost_filenames

total_frames.description: Total number of frames in the thread.
total_frames.name: total_frames

total_physical_memory.description: The total amount of physical memory.
total_physical_memory.name: total_physical_memory

total_virtual_memory.description: The size of the user-mode portion of the virtual address space of the calling process. This value depends on the type of process, the type of processor, and the configuration of the operating system. 32-bit processes usually have values in the range 2--4 GiB. 64-bit processes usually have *much* larger values.
total_virtual_memory.name: total_virtual_memory

uptime.description: Length of time the process was running before it crashed. Small values (from 0 to 5 or so) usually indicate start-up crashes.
uptime.name: uptime

url.description: The website which the user most recently visited in the browser before the crash. Users have the option of opting in or out of sending the current URL. This information may not always be valuable, because pages in other tabs or windows may be responsible for a particular crash.
url.name: url

user_comments.description: Comments entered by the user when they crashed.
user_comments.name: user_comments

useragent_locale.description: The locale of the software installation.
useragent_locale.name: useragent_locale

version.description: The product version number. A value lacking any letters indicates a normal release; a value with a 'b' indicates a Beta release; a value with an 'a' indicates an Aurora (a.k.a. Developer Edition) release; a value with 'esr' indicates an Extended Service Release.
version.name: version

winsock_lsp.description: On Windows, a string of data from the Windows OS about the list of installed LSPs (Layered Service Provider).
winsock_lsp.name: winsock_lsp
